title: Evangelize the End
description: You spend time preaching the End Times. While your sermons certainly aren’t for everyone, your methods avoid deliberately antagonizing those who see hope in the world while simultaneously providing ease and calm to the more desperate among the kingdom’s citizens. Attempt a basic Folklore check to determine how effective your sermons are.

criticalSuccess.msg: Your prayers soothe and calm the more criminal-minded citizens for the time being. <button type="button" class="km-gain-lose" data-type="unrest" data-mode="lose" data-turn="now" data-multiple="false" data-value="1d4">Lose 1d4 Unrest</button>, and either <button type="button" class="km-gain-lose" data-type="crime" data-mode="lose" data-turn="now" data-multiple="false" data-value="2">Lose 2 Crime</button> or <button type="button" class="km-gain-lose" data-type="corruption" data-mode="lose" data-turn="now" data-multiple="false" data-value="1">Lose 1 Corruption</button> or <button type="button" class="km-gain-lose" data-type="strife" data-mode="lose" data-turn="now" data-multiple="false" data-value="1">Lose 1 Strife</button>.

success.msg: Your prayers serve to redirect and calm discord. <button type="button" class="km-gain-lose" data-type="unrest" data-mode="lose" data-turn="now" data-multiple="false" data-value="1d3">Lose 1d3 Unrest</button>

failure.msg: Your prayers serve to redirect and calm discord. <button type="button" class="km-gain-lose" data-type="unrest" data-mode="lose" data-turn="now" data-multiple="false" data-value="1">Lose 1 Unrest</button>

criticalFailure.msg: Your prayers have unsettled some of your citizens. <button type="button" class="km-gain-lose" data-type="unrest" data-mode="gain" data-turn="now" data-multiple="false" data-value="1d4">Gain 1d4 Unrest</button> and <button type="button" class="km-gain-lose" data-type="decay" data-mode="gain" data-turn="now" data-multiple="false" data-value="1">Gain 1 Decay</button>
